page.title: 11APPLE ORCHARDS-CANON PYON
page.content: Old style orchards with{standard trees are rapidly disappearing and being replaced by densely planted dwarf trees for main cider producer{Bulmers, in Hereford.Still a few independent producers.Eating and cooking apples mainly grown by house owners as very few farms now have old style orchards. In autumn common sight on roads is a tractor pulling trailer load of cider fruit for processing in Hereford.A quota system is operated by Bulmers, the worlds largest cider makers,which entails the farmer delivering a set amount of fruit on an exact day and time.Highest prices are paid for preferred varieties e.g{White Norman. {'Yaffles'- Green woodpeckers,}Bulmers trade mark, are less common in the area due to lack of big apple trees and effects of{Dutch Elm}disease.
